com.moosemorals.weather

Class Fetcher

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.moosemorals.weather.Fetcher

  • public class Fetcher
extends Object
    Fetch weather data from the backend, using a provided HttpClient or building one if needed.

    Build and set options on a Fetcher using Fetcher.Builder, and then call @{#fetch(String) fetch} to get the result.
    Author:
    Osric Wilkinson

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Fetcher.Builder
      Build a Fetcher and set its options.

    • Field Detail

      • BOILERPLATE

        public static final String BOILERPLATE
        Required link back to the API. Code that uses the api must display a link to the provider. This is how they recommend you format it.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • fetch

        public FetchResult fetch()
                  throws IOException
        Fetch weather report using parameters set in the builder.

        Returns a FetchResult that either contains a WeatherReport or an ErrorReport.
        Returns:
        FetchResult containing weather data, or an error
        Throws:
        IOException - if there are network problems
